topic.title: What's New in WebHelp Responsive (20 Version)
topic.shortdesc: Introduces the Publishing Template concept, change the default layout making it more functional, add more graphical components.

section.title: Publishing Template Concept
section.p: Publishing Template defines all aspects related with the look and feel(layout and styles) of the WebHelp Responsive output.

A oXygen Publishing Template represents a customization package that you can easily share with your team. It is designed as a self-contained package stored either as a ZIP archive or as a folder on disk.

section.title: Built-in Publishing Templates Gallery Improved
section.p: The built-in templates gallery, available in the Templates tab in WebHelp Responsive transformation scenarios, was improved to make it easier to access, filter, and find templates.

section.title: User Defined Publishing Template Galleries
section.p: Besides the built-in publishing templates gallery, you can define your own templates gallery containing your custom templates.
Moreover, you can associate a publishing template gallery with a project, allowing you to easily share the publishing template with your team.

section.title: Default Output Layout was Improved
section.draft-comment: WH-1675 Modify the actual WebHelp template to include the 'On this page' component
section.p: The default layout of the WebHelp Responsive out was improved increasing the way you browser your documentation. The output browsing is driven by two axis, first you will find your topic by using a global Publication TOC. After you find a topic, you can navigate through its content using the Topic TOC component.

section.title: The Topic TOC component was added
section.p: The Topic TOC component helps you to navigate through the structure of the current topic. If presents links to all major topic sections. More over, it is synchronized with topic scroll position highlighting the current displayed section.

section.title: Highlight Image Map Hotspots

draft-comment.author: radu_pisoi
draft-comment.p: WH-240 - [WebHelp Responsive] Highlight image map areas

section.p: Added support to automatically add highlights when you move mouse over image map hotspots.

section.title: Expand/Collapse All Button Added
section.draft-comment: WH-1520 - Add "Expand/Collapse All" button in WH Responsive output
section.p: Expand/Collapse All button allows you to easily expand or collapse all the collapsible topic sections.

section.title: Display image on entire screen in a modal window
section.draft-comment: WH-1472 - Show image in original size on click
section.p: For the responsive images displayed with a smaller dimension than the original one, you can click on the image to see it using the entire screen.

section.title: Added Possibility to Control the Initial State of the Collapsible ElementsWH-235 - [WebHelp Responsive] Add the possibility to control the initial state of the collapsible elements
section.p: A new parameters was added to set the initial state of the collapsible elements. The parameter name is webhelp.topic.collapsible.elements.initial.state with the possible values: collapsed and expanded(the default value).

section.title: Publication TOC component receives a compact presentation mode
section.draft-comment: WH-231 - Make the selected topic visible in side TOC when it has too many siblings
section.p: This compact presentation mode makes easy to find the current selected topic by hiding the topics that are outside of the reading context. It is useful for publications with a complex structure.
